title: Discovering the Higgs Boson
author: Maria Smith
column8: physicists at CERN announced the discovery of a new particle
column9: now known as the Higgs boson. This discovery was made possible through the use of the Large Hadron Collider
column10: which collided protons at high energy in order to search for new particles. The Higgs boson is named after physicist Peter Higgs
column11: who proposed its existence in 1964 as a way to explain the origin of mass in the universe.

title: The Birth of Quantum Mechanics
author: Albert Einstein
column7: a new theory of physics called quantum mechanics was developed. This theory revolutionized our understanding of the fundamental nature of the universe
column8: and has had profound implications for fields such as chemistry
column10: and computing. Quantum mechanics was developed by a group of physicists
column14: who made pioneering contributions to the field.

title: The Pythagorean Theorem
author: Pythagoras
text: The Pythagorean Theorem states that in a right triangle
column7: the square of the length of the hypotenuse (the side opposite the right angle) is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides. This theorem can be written as a^2 + b^2 = c^2
column8: where a and b are the lengths of the other two sides
column9: and c is the length of the hypotenuse. The Pythagorean Theorem has many important applications in mathematics
